intro: Seseli intermedium, commonly known as intermediate sesel, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its tall, slender stems and compound umbels of small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. Its leaves are finely divided and often have a mild, aromatic scent. Seseli intermedium is native to Europe and parts of Asia, and it is often found in disturbed soils or along roadsides.
